newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: KLM Cargo willing to handle sea containers.
newsitem.headline: KLM Cargo willing to handle sea containers.

text.p: KLM Royal Dutch Airlines NV Cargo is now willing to handle and transport sea containers for customers if requested, a KLM Cargo spokesman told Reuters.

He said: "Sometimes clients request a combined form of transportation, using both sea and air. For instance a container could be delivered by ship then we may transport it to the airport. KLM would then arrange shipment of the container's contents by air to the the final destination."
Warehousing could also be arranged, he said, in cooperation with the Cargo Service Centre, KLM's cargo handling subsidiary.
Currently, he said the scheme is very limited and only being carried out when customers request such a service.
He added that the Dutch airline is not working with specific shipping lines.
Essentially, he said this is adding another form of transport to KLM Cargo's services that of sea-air transporation. --Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542-7706 Fax+5017
